#### 9am: Functions and Parameters

[Introductory activity](Activities/Introduction/introductory-activity.html)

Technology: Accessing the web server and RStudio

Assignment: Data and eyeballing parameters.
* Introduction to enough R to let them load and plot data
    * `fetchData()`
    * `plotPoints()`
* Load in the data files and find the parameters.  Data files illustrate several of the function types:
    * Exponentials
       * Income-housing for exponential. [exercise](http://rpubs.com/dtkaplan/558)
       * `stan-data.csv` for exponential. [Is cooling exponential?](http://rpubs.com/dtkaplan/558)
    * Trigonometric
       * tides for sine wave [from PREP2012](http://prep2012.mosaic-web.org/Topics/Tides/tides-hawaii.html)
    * Power Law
       * atomic bomb radius versus time
    * S-curves
       * gaussian and its cumulative as an S-curve
       * logistic function
       * [Hill function](http://prep2012.mosaic-web.org/Topics/Functions/hillFunctions.html)
    * Gaussian bump 
        * Ben Baumer's shortstop example
    * Quadratic
        * Kepler's orbit
